availability.licence: This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution-ShareAlike 4.0 International License.

correction.p: OCR generated transcript has not been corrected.

normalization.p: Only minor normalization where needed, if any, is indicated via markup.

punctuation.p: All punctuation marks in the source text have been retained, and are represented by appropriate Unicode code points.
Punctuation may be marked up with pc elements for clarification, but not exclusively.

quotation.p: All quotation marks have been retained, and are represented by appropriate Unicode code points.

hyphenation.p: Hyphenated words that appear at the end of a line have been retained. The hyphen, if present, is represented by the Unicode code point, and marked up with a pc element. The break="no" attribute on the lb element indicates that a single word is split across the lines.

interpretation.p: Dates, places, and names may be marked up, where useful.

body.ab:
—Married July 3, at eight-thirty P. M.
in the St. Thomas Rectory by the Rever‐
end Samuel F. Burhans, Mr. Fred C.
Mosher of Hamilton, son of Mr. and Mrs.
Louis Mosher and Miss Alice Harrison of
Hornby. They were attended by Mr. and
Mrs. John Harrison. They will be at home
in the Hitchcock apartment on Madison
Street after this week. Miss Alice Harrison
is the daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Elmer
Harrison of Hornby, New York.
1934
2 Full Name of Child BARRY REXFORD MOSHER
7 Date of birth SEPT 1 1937
Diocese of Central New York
In the Name of the Father, and of the Son,
and of the holy Ghost. Amen.
This is to certify that
Barry Rexford Mosher
presented by
Samuel F Burhans Rector
received the Apostolic Rite of Laying on
of Hands at a Confirmation held in
St. Thomas Church
Sunday Mar. 13, 1949 A.D.
By the Right Reverend
Bishop

Class of 1959
requests the honor of your presence
at the
153rd Commencement Exercises
of
Rensselaer Polytechnic Institute
on Friday, June the fifth
at two-fifteen o'clock

GENERAL INSTRUCTIONS TO CLAIMANT
1. Keep this book even if you get a [ob. You may
need it again.
2. Bring it v/ith you every time you report to an
insurance office or a placement office of the Division
of Employment.
3. In the pocket of this book keep any Record of
Employment slips (Form lA 12.3) given you by em
ployers. Your employer is required to give you a
Record of Employment slip if you lose or quit a job,
and you are required to present all slips received in
the past 52 weeks whenever you file a ijew benefit
claim.
4. Read and learn the instructions in the booklet
''Claimant's Booklet of Information" so you will know
your rights under the Unemployment Insurance taw
and what you must do to obtain and protect them.
5. If you have any questions, seek the answers at
your local insurance office. This will ensure that you
receive correct information. You should not rely on
unemployment insurance information you get from
anyone not connected with the Division of Employ
ment.
AlWAYS GIVE YOUR SOCIAL SECURITY ACCOUNT
NUAABER WHEN MAKING INQUIRY.
IMPORTANT NOTICE
The law provides severe penalties for
false statements wilfully made to obtain
benefits.

OPEN HOUSE PARTICIPANTS — George Wetherell, center, con
gratulates Dr. George AngeU, guest speaker at Monday evening's open
house at ECS, following the meeting. Dr. AngeU was introduced by
EUsworth W. Knapp, at the left. Next to Mr. Knapp stands Mrs. Alice
Mosher, president of the Earlvilie Teachers Association. Clifford
Nower, president of the Board of Education, watches from the right.
